subject: Mental Health
title: Fight, Flight, Freeze, Fawn
description: A quick win: understand Fight, Flight, Freeze, Fawn.

hook.text: Fight or flight is only half the story. The brain has two more survival modes.

buildup.text: Freeze happens when running or fighting seems impossible ‚Äî the body shuts down.

discovery.text: Fawn means appeasing the threat to survive ‚Äî agreeing, pleasing, or submitting.

twist.text: Freeze and fawn often get misread as weakness or compliance, but they're survival.

climax.text: Which response activates depends on the brain's split-second threat calculation.

punchline.text: Every trauma response is the brain choosing survival.

quiz.question: What is the 'fawn' response to trauma?
